texts: You can only have the discount for 1 vehicle at a time.
If you are the registered keeper of the vehicle, it must be registered with the DVLA or in your name and at the address you are using to apply for the residents' discount.
You can also add a company car or lease vehicle as long as it is for your own use only.

Based on the vehicle details entered and information held by the DVLA and TfL today, your vehicle is eligible for a 100% discount from the Congestion Charge. If you believe this is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, add this vehicle or apply for a discount, then you can continue with this process.
This may change - always check to see if you need to pay to drive within the zone.

Based on the vehicle details entered and information held by the DVLA and TfL today, this vehicle is exempt from the Congestion Charge. If you believe this is incorrect and you still want to pay the Congestion Charge, add this vehicle or apply for a discount, then you can continue with this process.
This may change - always check to see if you need to pay to drive within the zone.
If the number plate is correct but the vehicle description shown is wrong, you can still continue to add this vehicle.
Vehicle information is provided to TfL by the DVLA and the DVA, so you'll need to let the DVLA or DVA know if your details are wrong or need to be updated
We do not hold any details for this vehicle
If your UK-registered vehicle's make and model details have not been returned, make sure you entered the number plate correctly before continuing.

You need to pay the T-Charge to drive your vehicle within the Congestion Charge area if it does not meet the required emissions standard. If you qualify for the 90% residents' discount you also get a 90% discount from the T-Charge.
